channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Tanzania ‘cautious’ on CBDC adoption after initial research
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Stephen Katte
item.description: The Bank of Tanzania is waiting for the conclusion of its research into CBDCs before making a final decision on adoption.

item.title: Google Ads-delivered malware drains NFT influencer’s entire crypto wallet
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: A sponsored advertising link on Google hid malware that siphoned thousands of dollars worth of crypto and NFTs from an influencer’s wallet.

item.title: Scaramucci to invest in crypto firm founded by former FTX US boss
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: It is understood the crypto software company will enable crypto traders to create algorithmic-based strategies to access different markets.

item.title: Bank of Thailand to allow first virtual banks by 2025
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: By allowing virtual banks, Thailand seeks to boost competition and economic growth.

item.title: 5 altcoins that could breakout if Bitcoin price stays bullish
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin has turned bullish, but is it a dead cat bounce? If BTC bulls keep pace, LTC, OKB, BIT and FTM could see strong rallies.

item.title: Nexo investigation is not political, Bulgarian prosecutors say
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: A spokesperson for Bulgaria’s chief prosecutors has denied claims that the investigation was prompted by the company’s political donations.

item.title: Bitcoin fails to convince that bottom is in with $12K ‘still likely’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price optimism is limited at best after multi-month highs, with Bitcoin traders fearing a reversion to macro lows.

item.title: Navigating the World of Crypto: Tips for Avoiding Scams
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Noah Washington
item.description: From "pig butchering" to phishing, there are myriad ways that scammers try to take advantage of crypto users.

item.title: The aftermath of LBRY: Consequences of crypto’s ongoing regulatory process
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Diana Aguilar
item.description: What could the case of LBRY mean for future token projects in the United States?

item.title: Former FTX US President lashes out at ‘insecure’ SBF in 49-part Twitter thread rant
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Harrison said Bankman-Fried threatened to fire him on the spot and would destroy his professional reputation if he continued to confront the former FTX CEO.

item.title: Polygon primed for hard fork aimed at reducing gas fee spikes: New details revealed
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Polygon told Cointelegraph that the hard fork will take effect at block 38,189,056, which will be initiated without the influence of centralized actors.

item.title: One of the largest US colleges has begun teaching students about Bitcoin
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: The professor said a “Programming Bitcoin” course will follow the first Bitcoin course, where students will learn how to “build a Bitcoin library from scratch.”

item.title: Solana Foundation warns about security incident with Mailchimp
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: According to an email sent to users, an unauthorized actor accessed and exported certain user data from the Solana Foundation’s Mailchimp instance.

item.title: SBF denies stealing FTX assets, SEC charges Gemini and Genesis, and more: Hodler’s Digest: Jan. 8-14
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Editorial Staff

item.title: Alameda Research had a $65B secret line of credit with FTX: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Sam Bankman-Fried ordered Gary Wang, FTX’s co-founder, to open the alleged credit line financed by the exchange’s customers.

item.title: How to connect the Avalanche network to MetaMask?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Emi Lacapra
item.description: Avalanche users can enjoy Ethereum Web3 and DeFi applications by connecting the network to MetaMask. Here’s a step-by-step guide to doing it.

item.title: New York sued by environmental group after approval of crypto mining facility: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The approval violates the New York climate law of 2019, plaintiffs claim. The facility was acquired by the Canadian crypto mining firm Digihost.

item.title: Cointelegraph heads to Davos for World Economic Forum
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Cointelegraph will be on the ground as prominent figures from the cryptocurrency and blockchain space converge on Davos during the World Economic Forum.

item.title: Gemini and Genesis’ legal troubles stand to shake up industry further
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Shiraz Jagati
item.description: Now that the SEC has gotten involved in the ongoing Gemini–Genesis spat, things could get ugly for both parties in the near term.

item.title: App-specific blockchains remain a promising solution for scalability
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Inigo Vaca
item.description: Building an interoperable network of blockchains dedicated to a specific purpose appears to be a viable alternative to layer-2 scalability solutions.

item.title: Can Canada stay a crypto mining hub after Manitoba’s moratorium?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: Local stakeholders believe that a crypto mining moratorium might actually mean the beginning of a new dialogue between the government and the industry.

item.title: Polygon tests zero-knowledge rollups, mainnet integration inbound
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Polygon takes zero-knowledge rollups to the final testnet to gauge the performance of its zkEVM ahead of eventual mainnet integration.

item.title: Bitcoin price blasts past $21K as 3-day short liquidations near $300M
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin knocks out a key moving average unchallenged since before its $69,000 all-time highs in a wild few days of straight BTC price gains.

item.title: Skybridge eyes stake buyback from FTX, as Galaxy CEO says he would like to ‘punch’ SBF
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: Anthony Scarammuci also noted that there was “clearly fraud” in the SBF and FTX debacle, while Mike Novogratz said there’s a side of him that would like to “punch” SBF in the face.

item.title: Logan Paul unveils $1.5M CryptoZoo recovery plan
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: As part of the plan, Logan Paul stated that he will commit 1,000 ETH to repay disgruntled investors that want to make an exit via burning their CryptoZoo NFTs.

item.title: Total crypto market cap closes in on $1T right as Bitcoin price moves toward $20K
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Crypto traders chase after neutral-to-bullish options as Bitcoin price targets $20,000 and the total crypto market cap surges above $900 billion.

item.title: Grayscale files brief in ETF suit against SEC, oral arguments may come within months
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Grayscale appealed the SEC’s denial of its application to create a spot BTC ETF in June; the case “is moving swiftly,” according to the Grayscale chief legal officer.

item.title: Alameda Research liquidators lost $72K during fund consolidation attempt
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: The loss occurred while Alameda Research’s liquidators were attempting to close a borrow position on Aave but instead removed the extra collateral used for the position.

item.title: Bitcoin price rally over $21K prompts analysts to explore where BTC price might go next
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kyle White
item.description: Bitcoin price is steamrolling above the all-important $20,000 level, leading analysts to speculate on where BTC price might go.

item.title: 3 blockchain use cases that extend beyond crypto
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Blockchains are decentralized, transparent and increase the capacity of a whole network while giving users full control of their data.
